name: 42 Macro
title: The Macro Minute: Will Tariffs Tank The US Economy?
text:
Synopsis
The US economy is likely to remain resilient despite upcoming tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico, with potential medium-term growth slowdown and shifting market dynamics driven by policy uncertainty and evolving economic conditions.

Key Insights
- President Trump confirmed 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico starting February 1, with potential retaliation from both countries
- Six pillars continue to support the US economy's resilience, with trade not significantly impacting overall GDP
- Low probability of recession in the medium-term time horizon
- Consensus expects US growth to continue slowing due to:
  - Elevated policy uncertainty
  - Steepening base effects
  - Slowing labor supply growth
  - Likely reduction in federal expenditures
- GDP growth expected to report in line or slightly below consensus estimates in the next few quarters
- Potential market shifts include:
  - Possible bond market support
  - Potential risk asset valuation adjustments
- Emerging trend of potential capital rotation from AI enablers (like Nvidia) to AI adopters and enterprise/consumer AI application developers
- Debt ceiling dynamics creating temporary positive catalysts for asset markets by reducing Treasury coupon supply
